body:
Comment 4 by **0x6a67**: 
Yes, this fixes issue, but description is a little misleading.
When console executable with unsatisfied import is invoked from command window/batch
file, it's silently not run by os and errorlevel variable is not touched.

While testing on single core machine with Windows XP, i saw this kind of errors:
ok  	regexp	0.741s
ok  	regexp/syntax	2.934s
panic: test timed out after 2m0s

goroutine 377 [running]:
runtime.panic(0x5adde0, 0x10da21f8)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/runtime/panic.c:279 +0xd1
testing.func┬Ě008()
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/testing/testing.go:628 +0xfe
created by time.goFunc
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/time/sleep.go:121 +0x46

goroutine 16 [chan receive]:
testing.RunTests(0x6d6708, 0x7acf00, 0x66, 0x66, 0x425401)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/testing/testing.go:504 +0x731
testing.Main(0x6d6708, 0x7acf00, 0x66, 0x66, 0x7adfe0, ...)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/testing/testing.go:435 +0xa0
main.main()
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/tmp/go-build625578459/runtime/_test/_testmain.go:589 +0x82

goroutine 373 [syscall]:
syscall.Syscall(0x7c802530, 0x2, 0x730, 0xffffffff, 0x0, ...)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/runtime/syscall_windows.goc:55 +0x4b
syscall.WaitForSingleObject(0x730, 0xffffffff, 0x31059fc8, 0x0, 0x0)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/syscall/zsyscall_windows_386.go:674 +0x88
os.(*Process).wait(0x10d61000, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/os/exec_windows.go:16 +0x8e
os.(*Process).Wait(0x10d61000, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/os/doc.go:45 +0x3a
os/exec.(*Cmd).Wait(0x10db9400, 0x0, 0x0)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/os/exec/exec.go:320 +0x144
os/exec.(*Cmd).Run(0x10db9400, 0x0, 0x0)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/os/exec/exec.go:237 +0x6f
os/exec.(*Cmd).CombinedOutput(0x10db9400, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, ...)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/os/exec/exec.go:364 +0x1fc
runtime_test.executeTest(0x10dc63c0, 0x6dbc28, 0x23c, 0x58fca0, 0x10d60388, ...)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/runtime/crash_test.go:58 +0x59e
runtime_test.testCrashHandler(0x10dc63c0, 0x7afc01)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/runtime/crash_test.go:77 +0x9f
runtime_test.TestCgoCrashHandler(0x10dc63c0)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/runtime/crash_cgo_test.go:15 +0x2f
testing.tRunner(0x10dc63c0, 0x7acf60)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/testing/testing.go:422 +0xa9

	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/runtime/syscall_windows.goc:72 +0x4b

	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/syscall/zsyscall_windows_386.go:267 +0xc0

	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/syscall/syscall_windows.go:267 +0x90
os.(*File).read(0x10da21c0, 0x10e18620, 0x5e0, 0x5e0, 0x0, ...)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/os/file_windows.go:296 +0x101
os.(*File).Read(0x10da21c0, 0x10e18620, 0x5e0, 0x5e0, 0xb, ...)

os/exec.func┬Ě004(0x10d60dd0)
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/os/exec/exec.go:284 +0x3b
created by os/exec.(*Cmd).Start
	D:/opt/usr/src/go/jtip/src/pkg/os/exec/exec.go:285 +0x6b8
FAIL	runtime	122.897s
?   	runtime/cgo	[no test files]
ok  	runtime/debug	0.220s

but after https://golang.org/cl/80400043/
all tests passed.

Thanks.
